subject: Cybersecurity
title: Baiting: The Free USB Trap
description: A quick win: understand Baiting: The Free USB Trap.

hook.text: Someone drops a USB drive labeled 'Salary Report 2025' in your office parking lot. Would you plug it in?

buildup.text: Baiting exploits curiosity. Attackers leave infected USBs in parking lots, lobbies, and conference rooms.

discovery.text: Studies show 48% of people plug in found USB drives. Some do it within minutes of finding one.

twist.text: The U.S. military was breached in 2008 when an infected USB was plugged into a classified network in the Middle East.

climax.text: Baiting works because curiosity is stronger than caution for nearly half of all people.

punchline.text: Half of people plug in mystery USB drives. Are you the other half?

quiz.question: What percentage of people plug in found USB drives?
